intro: Reseda dshebeli, commonly known as the Caucasian Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has narrow, linear leaves. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Reseda dshebeli is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
